hints.content:
When we add a number, we jump that distance to the right on the number line.

To show $\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}$, we need to show $\maroonD{7}$ jumps of $\blueD{5}$ units.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 35 with tick marks at every 5 units. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30,  and 35. Each arrow is labeled plus five. !

hints.content:
This number line best represents $7\times 5$:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 35 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30,  and 35. !

choices.content: ![A number line labeled 0 to 35 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30,  and 35.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5f473df0661c4185ad643f354d8d35901518dfd4)

![A number line labeled 0 to 7 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 5 and 7.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/530089938619a6b726125bb140742a33525a019a)

![A number line labeled 0 to 49 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 7, 14, 21, 28, 35, 42, and 49.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e957788ae241ffd4172fa6ae06d23034a069d9c1)
